clinical_study.brief_title: Coarctation Of the Aorta Stent Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Coarctation Of the Aorta Stent Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Cheatham Platinum bare metal stents are safe and effective in the treatment of native and recurrent aortic coarctation in selected children, adolescents and adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Difference Between Arm and Leg Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Noninvasive systolic blood pressures are measured in the arms and legs at baseline and 12 month follow-up. The difference between these measurements are calculated. The difference between systolic arm and leg blood pressures decreased by 30 ± 22 mmHg (n=90)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Systolic Blood Pressure Greater Than the 95th Percentile for Age and Gender 12 Months Post Stent Placement
secondary_outcome.description: Noninvasive Blood pressure is assessed at baseline and 12 months. The number of patients with a Systolic Blood Pressure > 95th Percentile for Age and Gender is recorded at Baseline (n=105) and compared to 12 month follow up (n=92).

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic Blood Pressure, Difference Between Upper and Lower Extremities
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of difference between upper and lower extremities by noninvasive, automated measurement of four quadrant Systolic Blood Pressure. Comparison between baseline and 12 month follow up.

intervention.description: Transcatheter delivery of a metallic stent to enlarge region of aortic narrowing caused by the coarctation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Native or recurrent aortic coarctation
- Weight greater than or equal to 35 kg
- Noninvasive, arm-leg cuff systolic blood pressure difference or catheter measured systolic coarctation gradient greater than or equal to 20 mmHg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age > 60 years
- Connective tissue disorders, including Marfan syndrome and other genetic syndromes such as Turner syndrome and Noonan syndrome
- Inflammatory aortitis
- Bloodstream infection, including endocarditis
- Pregnancy
- Aortic aneurysm
- Prior stent placement
- Adults lacking capacity to consent
- Foster children and/or wards of the court

participants_list.participants: 168 consents, 57 failed cath criteria, 5 met criteria but received covered stent, 1 withdrew consent
